intro: Glaucium oxylobum subsp. rechingeri, commonly known as the Rechinger's gloryflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
